column1:
If
3x
(x+3)(x+11)(x+4)
 = A(x+3) + B(x+11) + C(x+4)

then find the value of A,B and C
column8:
Rearrange the equation in the form
3x = A(x+11)(x+4) + B(x+3)(x+4) + C(x+3)(x+11)
column9:
Substitute different values of x such that two of the terms are removed
from the equation to get one of the co-efficients. Repeat the process to get the values of the other coefficients
column10:
Based on the above hint , you need to substitute the value of x = -3
to get the value of A , x = -11 to get the value of B and x = -4 to get the value of C
column13: Your answer is correct! Let's try the next one
column14: You've got two of the coefficients correct i.e.  VALUES OF A and B but the third coefficient is incorrect. Let's try the next one
